org.androidannotations.annotations

Annotation Type SupposeBackground


  • @Retention(value=CLASS)
@Target(value=METHOD)
public @interface SupposeBackground

    Ensures that the method is called from the background thread with (optionally) restrictions by allowed serials. If it is not called from a supposed background thread, then IllegalStateException will be thrown (by default).

    Example : 
     @EBean
 public class MyBean {

        @SupposeBackground
        boolean someMethodThatShouldNotBeCalledFromUiThread() {
                //if this method will be called from the UI-thread an exception will be thrown
    }

        @SupposeBackground(serial = {"serial1", "serial2"})
        boolean someMethodThatShouldBeCalledFromSerial1OrSerial2() {
                //if this method will be called from another thread then a background thread with a
                //serial "serial1" or "serial2", an exception will be thrown
    }

 }
    See Also:
    BackgroundExecutor.setWrongThreadListener(BackgroundExecutor.WrongThreadListener), BackgroundExecutor.DEFAULT_WRONG_THREAD_LISTENER, BackgroundExecutor.checkBgThread(String...)

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      java.lang.String[] serial 

    • Element Detail

      • serial

        public abstract java.lang.String[] serial
        Returns:
        Allowed serials to restrict a calling thread. If it is an empty list, then any background thread is allowed.
        See Also:
        BackgroundExecutor.checkBgThread(String...)
        Default:
        {}
